content.description: This is the easiest way up the face.  Undercling and balance up right with your feet on an arching crack/foothold, step right to a couple of holds.  The crux is moving back left to a small flake/crack, then cruise up to the anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts for a TR anchor are the only pro.  It's an easy scramble up the NE corner to set it up.  I guess a couple crash pads would keep you alive if you wanted to boulder it.
content.location: Climb the right side of the slab....

content.description:
This is the cleanest most obvious line, but also really hard....

I actually have no idea how hard, since I got rained off before finishing.  It starts off reasonable, then gets steeper and blanker at a little bulge.  Smear and claw....
content.protection: TR from bolts, or very insecure high ball....
content.location: The clean line in the middle of the rock right off the trail.
